sen.j: 日置流（へきりゅう）とは、古流の逸見流を学んだ日置弾正政次（へきだんじょうまさつぐ）（正次とも）が確立した、和弓の流派の一つである。
sen.e: Heki-ryu school established by Masatsugu Danjo HEKI, who learnt the ancient Henmi-ryu school.

Heki school was established by Masatsugu Danjo HEKI, who learned in the ancient Henmi school.

sen.j: 日置弾正正次は室町時代（15世紀後半）の人といわれているが諸説あり、神仏の化身と称されたり、日置吉田流初代・吉田上野介重賢であるとされたり（同一人物説）する。
sen.e: Masatsugu Danjo HEKI is said to be a person of Muromachi Era (the latter half of the 15th century). However, there are various opinions. Some says he was god or Buddha' incarnation. Some says he was the same person as the first representative of Heki-yoshida-ryu school Shigetaka Kozukenosuke YOSHIDA. After all, the theory that he was a fictitious character is persuasive.

sen.j: 日本の弓道は、主に戦場における徒歩による弓射から発展した「歩射」と、馬上から射る弓射から発展した「騎射」、三十三間堂における通し矢の弓射から発展した「堂射」に分類することが出来る。
sen.e: Archery in Japan can be classified mainly into "Busha/Kachiyumi (walking archery)", which was developed from bow shooting on foot in a battlefield, "Kisha (riding archery)", which was developed from bow shooting while riding horse, and "Dosha (long-range archery)", which was developed from Toshiya (long-range archery) passing through the Sanjusangendo Temple.

Archery in Japan can be classified mainly into "Busha/Kachiyumi (walking archery)," developed from bow shooting on foot on the battlefield, "Kisha (riding archery)," developed from bow shooting while riding horseback, and "Dosha (long-range archery)," developed from Toshiya (long-range archery) passing through the Sanjusangendo Temple.

Archery in Japan can be classified mainly into 'Busha/Kachiyumi' (walking archery), developed from bow shooting on foot on the battlefield, 'Kisha' (riding archery), developed from bow shooting while riding horseback, and 'Dosha' (long-range archery), developed from Toshiya (long-range archery) passing through the Sanjusangen-do Temple.

sen.j: 今日的な分類では、弓道を武射と礼射に分ける考え方が主流となった。
sen.e: In a modern classification, the idea that divided archery into busha (archery for battle) and reisha (archery for ceremony) has become the main common practice.

sen.j: 武射系と言えば日置流系統の射を指し（この場合は歩射・堂射が含まれている）、礼射系と言えば、小笠原流騎射・歩射から儀礼・儀式的なものを加味されつつ発展した射の系統を指す。
sen.e: When it comes to busha group, it refers to Heki school system. (In this case, it includes walking archery and long-range archery). When it comes to reisha group, it refers to the shooting system developed from Ogasawara-ryu school's riding archery and walking archery but gradually implemented with ceremonial elements.

When it comes to the busha group, it refers to the Heki school system. (In this case, it includes walking archery and long-range archery). When it comes to the reisha group, it refers to the shooting system developed from Ogasawara-ryu school's riding archery and walking archery, but gradually implemented with ceremonial elements.

sen.j: 小笠原流が騎射を出発点とし、主に見た目の美しさや品位を重視するものであったのに対して、日置流は的中や矢の貫通力に重点を置いた実利的な歩兵用弓術であった。
sen.e: Ogasawara-ryu school originated from riding shoot emphasizes chiefly beauty and elegance of externals. On the contrary, the Heki school is a practical archery for infantrymen which put its emphasis on the targeting accuracy and the penetrating power of arrow.

sen.j: 現在では、同じ「弓道」という競技において、本来は目的の異なる別のものである「歩射」「騎射」「堂射」の違いを深く理解している射手は少数となってしまった。
sen.e: Nowadays, they are under the same category as the competitive game "Archery". There are a small number of archers who understand thoroughly the difference between "walking archery", "riding archery" and long-range archery", whose purposes are originally different.

sen.j: 日置流には、途切れたものや現存するものを含めると多くの派が存在するが、古来の「派」の位置付けは「教えを受けた～家・～師匠の流れを組むもの」程度の意味合いであったと考えられ、伝承してきた教えの解釈等の違いから生ずる小さな違いはあるが、根幹となる教えはどの派でも同一である。
sen.e: For Heki school, there are a lot of sects, including both the discontinued ones and the existing ones. Traditionally, "school" has been referring to "a system of unified style from a family or master with handed-down teachings". There may be minor differences caused from the discrepancies in interpretation of handed-down teachings. However, the teaching that forms the foundation of any sect is the same.

For the Heki school, there are a lot of sects, including both the discontinued ones and the existing ones. Traditionally, the "school" has been referring to "a system of unified styles from a family or master who passed down their teachings." There may be minor differences caused from discrepancies in interpretation of the teachings. However, teaching that forms the foundation of any sect is basically the same.

sen.j: 小笠原流が多くの場合、射の行程における打起しと呼ばれる動作において身体の正面で構える形、いわゆる「正面打起し」をとるのに対し、日置流では「斜面打起し」をとる。
sen.e: In many cases of Ogasawara-ryu school, there are facing postures of shooting at distance. That is, the so-called "Shomen-uchiokoshi (anchoring in front facing posture)" is taken. On the contrary, Heki-ryu school takes "Shamen-uchiokoshi (anchoring in slanting position)".

sen.j: 吉田重賢（太郎左衛門・上野介・出雲守など、号：道宝）（寛正4年（1463） - 天文 (元号)12年（1543））は南近江の戦国大名六角氏家臣で、川守城（現竜王町川守）を本拠としていたと伝わる。

It is also said that Shigekata YOSHIDA based his activities around Kawamori Castle (present's Kawamori, Ryuo-cho).

sen.j: また、岡山藩の印西派が当流と呼ばれる所以は、池田侯と当時の将軍が弓の勝負をした際に池田侯が勝利し、池田侯が当家でも「当流」と称させて欲しいと願い出たところ、将軍が褒美の意味で当流と称すことを許可した事から。
sen.e: Moreover, the reason why the Insai-ha school of Okayama domain was called "Toryu" is that, when the shogun at that time competed with Ikeda-ko (daimyo IKEDA) in an archery match, Ikeda-ko won. Ikeda-ko requested to be also called "Toryu" and the shogun allowed it for praising.

sen.j: 印西派は戦場で徒歩武者（かちむしゃ）(歩兵の意）が用いる射法である「歩射」であり、本来は馬上で弓を引く「騎射」の射法である小笠原流とは根本的にその土台が異なる。
sen.e: Insai-ha school is "walking archery", shooting method for walking troops (walking warriors) in battle field. Originally, it was different from Ogasawara-ryu school, which is a "riding archery", shooting method while riding a horse".

Insai-ha school is "walking archery," shooting method for walking troops (walking warriors) on the battle field. Originally, it was different from the Ogasawara-ryu school, which is "horseback riding archery," shooting from horseback."

Insai school is 'walking archery,' shooting method for walking troops (walking warriors) on the battle field; originally, it was different from the Ogasawara school, which is 'horseback riding archery,' shooting from horseback.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'に-ha削除スペース削除-ryu削除

sen.j: 印西派の本来の射法は「割膝（わりひざ）」という膝立ちの体勢で弓を引くものであり、戦場で敵方から放たれる矢を避けて身を隠しながら、瞬間的に身を起こし敵を射るのに非常に適している。
sen.e: For Insai-ha school's original shooting method, a body pose of "opening knees" with one knee standing was adopted to pull the bow. While the body is hidden to avoid the arrow shot by the enemy in the battlefield, the body can readily be raised momentarily to shoot an enemy. So, it is very practical.

sen.j: 現代では、その割膝の練習段階とされる、立ったまま弓を引く「立射」の体勢が一般的である。
sen.e: In modern days, "opening knees" is assumed to be the practice stage, and the body pose of "Rissha (standing shoot)", that pulls the bow while standing, is general.
In modern days, "open knees" is assumed to be the practice stage, and the body pose of "Rissha (standing shoot)," that pulls the bow while standing, is the general position.

sen.j: 印西派の教えでは「貫（かん）・中（ちゅう）・久（きゅう）」の実践を最高とする。
sen.e: In the doctrine of the Insai-ha school, the highest levels of practice are Kan, Chu, and Kyu.
In the doctrine of the Insai-ha school, the highest levels of practice are Kan, Chu, and Kyu.
In the doctrine of the Insai school, the highest levels of practice are Kan, Chu, and Kyu.

sen.j: 「貫」は敵兵の鎧まで貫く強力な貫通力、「中」は百射百中の命中率、「久」は貫・中を永久に実践できることを意味する。
sen.e: "Kan (Penetration)" is a strong penetrating power that can pass through enemy's armor. "Chu (Precision)" is a hit rate of 100 hits out of 100 shoots. "Kyu (Persistence)" means "Kan" and "Chu" can be persistently maintained.

"Kan (Penetration)" is a strong penetrating power that can pass through enemy's armor. "Chu (Precision)" is a hit rate of 100 hits out of 100 shots. "Kyu (Persistence)" means "Kan" and "Chu" can be persistently maintained.

Kan' (Penetration) is a strong penetrating power that can pass through enemy's armor; 'Chu' (Precision) is a hit rate of 100 hits out of 100 shots; 'Kyu' (Persistence) means 'Kan' and 'Chu' can be persistently maintained.
sen.cmt: 一文にしました。原文の「」に合わせ"を'に

sen.j: つまり印西派は、弓矢が強力な武器であった時代において、戦場で戦う徒歩武者が如何に敵を射殺できるか、その鍛錬と戦場での実践のために編み出された射法であり、文字通り極めて実戦的かつ合理的なものである。
sen.e: In other words, the Insai-ha school is a shooting method designed in an era with powerful bow and arrow as to how a walking warrior who fights in the battlefield shoots an enemy dead. As the name suggests, it is extremely practical and reasonable.

In other words, the Insai-ha school teaches a shooting method conceived during an era when powerful bows and arrows were used and by walking warriors who fight on the battlefield to kill the enemy. As the name suggests, it is extremely practical and reasonable.

In other words, the Insai school teaches a shooting method conceived during an era when powerful bows and arrows were used and by walking warriors who fight on the battlefield to kill the enemy, as the name suggests, it is extremely practical and reasonable.

sen.j: 現代の弓道においては通常の競技において的中主義であるため、貫通力の相対的価値が下がっていることもあり、今日では「中・貫・久」の実践を最高としているが、本来は「貫・中・久」である。
sen.e: In modern archery, for a usual game, emphasis is put on Tekichu-shugi (hitting the target). Because of this, penetration is relatively less valued. Nowadays, the praising order is "Precision, Penetration, and Persistence". Originally, the praising order should be "Penetration, Precision, and Persistence".

In modern archery, emphasis is put on Tekichu-shugi (hitting the target). Penetration is valued less. Nowadays, the praising order is "Precision, Penetration, and Persistenc." Originally, the praising order should be "Penetration, Precision, and Persistence".

In modern archery, since emphasis is put on Tekichu-shugi (hitting the target), penetration is valued less; nowadays, the praising order is 'Precision, Penetration and Persistenc', however, the praising order should be 'Penetration, Precision and Persistence' originally.
sen.cmt: 一文にしました。原文の「」に合わせ"を'に

sen.j: 印西派における射法の教えについて、物理学的・医学的等の見地からの研究が筑波大（旧東京教育大）で行われているが、その伝承されてきた事項について科学的な見地から否定されるものが一切発見されておらず、古来からの教えが戦場での経験に基づいた極めて合理的・科学的なことが裏付けられている。
sen.e: About doctrine of the shooting method in the Insai-ha school, University of Tsukuba (former Tokyo University of Education) is conducting a research of it from a medical and physical viewpoint. Concerning the contents in the doctrine, there has been nothing discovered at all that can be denied from a scientific viewpoint. Rather, it is proven that this ancient doctrine based on experiences in battlefields is extremely reasonable and scientific.

sen.j: 的は日置霞（へきがすみ）と呼ばれる独特の模様の物を用い、多人数で射る場合も一つの的を全員で射るのが本来正式である。
sen.e: The target, called "Hekigasumi", has a peculiar pattern (supposed to be like a human body). Even in the case when there are multiple players shooting, originally only one target is set formally.

sen.j: これは、集団で向かってくる敵兵の先頭の者を確実に射倒す事で、敵兵の戦意を削ぐ為である。
sen.e: The purpose is to shoot down for sure the person standing out first in the confronting enemy group, in order to destroy the enemy's fighting spirit.
The purpose is to shoot down for sure the person standing out first when confronting an enemy group, in order to destroy the enemy's fighting spirit.
The purpose is to shoot down for sure the person standing out first when confronting an enemy group, in order to destroy the enemy's fighting spirit.

sen.j: また、もし敵兵を射損じた場合でも、外れた矢が足元に突き刺さる方が、頭上を飛び越えて行くよりもより敵に恐怖感を与える事が出来るため、的は地面すれすれの低い場所に立てて稽古した。

It has succeeded from generation to generation up to the present time.

Higo-Chikurin school was temporarily discontinued after the Imperial restoration, however, it was later inherited by the family of karo (chief retainer of daimyo - Japanese territorial lord) of the former Kumamoto Domain by the Matsui clan, which was the eighth owner of the castle, and it has succeeded from generation to generation up to the present time.
sen.cmt: 一文にしました。Chikurinに訂正しました。-ha削除Domainに訂正しました。
